channel.title: Viewing your co-ordinates (Removing "Red Graph")
channel.description:
I know some people struggle doing this, and now that the /whois command is taken out some people will have no idea.
The usual way to view your current position in the world is to press F3. This brings up a debug screen, and at the top left there are co-ordinates, as you can see here (x, y, z are co-ordinates):
[img]http://cl.ly/5wk0/Screen_shot_2011-04-12_at_18.30.06.png[/img]
See the big red square at the bottom there? That (simply put) is measuring and visually showing you how much memory minecraft is using. A lot of people are having this problem: the red bar is covering their co-ordinates. I did a little searching and found this minecraft mod:
Name: FM DebugMod By: FinalMinuet Link: http://www.mediafire.com/?7m6zv42roqn2acl
This is very useful if you are having trouble getting your co-ordinates and thought it would be worth sharing here.
Happy mining guys,
Eddy.
